content: **___** **___** <big><big><big>**jali socks**</big></big></big> <big> this pattern is inspired by my love of indian food the yarn and the jali a jali is an indian architectural decoration an ornamental patterned and perforated stone or latticed screen which allows light and air in while minimising the sun and rain and providing passive ventilation to cool </big> <big>the jali patterning emerges from the toe and the heel flap and flows all the way to the cuff </big> <big>these socks whilst they might look complicated are relatively simple they are worked toe up and feature a wedge toe and heel flap </big> **___** **___** <big>**pattern information**</big> <big>**sizing**</big> adult a-56 b-64 c-72 d-80 sts finished circumference approx 15 5 18 20 22 cm/ 6 25 7 8 9 inches <big>**yarn**</big> 100g light fingering / fingering weight sock yarn solid semi-solid or tonal colourways would work well for this design <big>**gauge**</big> worked in the round and measured after washing and laying flat to dry 36 sts = 10 cm/4 inches over stockinette stitch the sock fit is similar to a stockinette stitch sock <big>**needles**</big> for working small circumference in the round 2 25 mm/us1 needles or size required to achieve gauge <big>**pattern formats** </big> the instructions for the construction of the socks are written and the central panel is both charted and written **low vision accessible** a low vision accessible version of this pattern are also available this version include 24 point arial all black text no italics no columns or tables and fully written instructions there are charts included but the charts are not needed to complete the pattern <big>**thank you**</big> thank you to joj38 hottann bells5r1 jeepgirl kleineanna13 joycoleman ciscavm spidermom peebs and other testers a huge thanks also to yarnymama and yalta for their ongoing valued advice guidance feedback and encouragement
